intro: Meliosma arnottiana var. hachijoensis, commonly known as the Hachijo meliosma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan, specifically the island of Hachijo-jima. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
